page.title: 04GLAN MORFA SCHOOL, ABERGELE
page.content: Ysgol Glan Morfa is an Infant and Junior School for children from Abergele and the surrounding district whose first language is Welsh. There are 125 pupils with 5 full time teachers, 1 part-time teacher and 2 nursery assistants. This new building was opened in 1957 and the head teacher's name is Mr. J. E. Hughes. The school day begins at 8.55 am and ends at 3.15 pm (3.00 pm for Infants). Children from outside Abergele are brought in and returned home by a private bus daily. The school uniform is blue and grey. School meals are supplied from the Infants' School kitchen which is on the same site. The site is also shared with St. Elfod's Junior School. At 11 years the children transfer to Ysgol y Creuddyn, the new Welsh language High School at Penrhyn Bay.
